abstract: Bank of America sold 230 billion yen ($2 billion) of global bonds on Friday, joining a handful of major banks that have sought to raise cash in Japan’s stable credit markets, Reuters reported Friday citing unnamed sources.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America sold 230 billion yen ($2 billion) of global bonds on Friday, joining a handful of major banks that have sought to raise cash in Japan’s stable credit markets, Reuters reported Friday citing unnamed sources.

headline.main: Bank of America Turns to Japan for Bond Sale
